conclusion: The light source is initially positioned above the objects, casting shadows A, B, and C on the ground.
The light source moves to the right, meaning it is now positioned further to the right compared to its initial position.
When the light source moves to the right, shadows will shift to the left relative to their original positions.

The size of the shadows can change depending on the distance from the light source to the objects; generally, shadows become larger as the light source moves closer and smaller as it moves farther away.
Shadow A (cast by the birdcage) will shift to the left as the light source moves to the right.
Shadow B (cast by the skull and knife) will shift to the left as the light source moves to the right.
Shadow C (cast by the chicken leg) will shift to the left as the light source moves to the right.
The size of each shadow will likely decrease because the light source is moving farther away from the objects.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, and C will move to the left and become smaller.
